intro: Galium aegeum, commonly known as the Aegean bedstraw, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny white flowers that bloom in the summer months. It thrives in dry, sunny habitats such as rocky soils and open woodlands. Galium aegeum is often used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported diuretic properties.
